newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ten Nazi mines found under Ukraine soccer field.
newsitem.headline: Ten Nazi mines found under Ukraine soccer field.

text.p: Ten mines placed by Nazi forces during World War Two have been found under a soccer pitch where the German and Ukrainian under-21 teams played a week ago, a spokesman for the stadium said on Friday.

"In addition to the three mines found late on Thursday, today military sappers found seven more German mines -- all dating from 1943," Olexander Serdyuk, a spokesman for Dynamo stadium, said by telephone.
The anti-infantry mines had been discovered about 1.5 metres (yards) below ground during modernisation work in the corner of the pitch, he said.
All the mines were removed and detonated on the outskirts of Kiev. "The sappers have investigated all the pitch and running tracks. They have assured us there are no more mines," he said.
"Probably a German mine-launcher was deployed at the stadium during World War Two and mines were abandoned after German troops left Kiev in 1943."
Dynamo Kiev, Ukraine's top soccer club, usually plays at the 40,000-seat stadium in the heart of the capital of the former Soviet republic.
